info.title: spoonacular API
info.description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 380,000 recipes, thousands of ingredients, 80,000 food products, and 100,000 menu items. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, whole 30, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Primal.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The (natural language) recipe search query.

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more comma separated. See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. See a full list of supported diets.

parameters.name: excludeIngredients
parameters.description: An comma-separated list of ingredients or ingredient types that must not be contained in the recipes.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found recipes must not have ingredients that could cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. See a full list of supported intolerances.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 900).

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return (between 1 and 100).

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

parameters.name: instructionsRequired
parameters.description: Whether the recipes must have instructions.

get.description: Our recipe API includes over 360,000 recipes as well as an open source recipe database. Consider using the "Search Recipes Complex" endpoint for much more flexibility.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that the recipes should contain.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The maximal number of recipes to return (between 1 and 100). Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

parameters.name: ranking
parameters.description: Whether to maximize used ingredients (1) or minimize missing ingredients (2) first.

parameters.name: ignorePantry
parameters.description: Whether to ignore pantry ingredients such as water, salt, flour etc.

get.description: Find recipes that use as many of the given ingredients as possible and have as little as possible missing ingredients. This is a "what's in your fridge" API endpoint.

parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of expected results (between 1 and 100).

parameters.name: random
parameters.description: If true, every request will give you a random set of recipes within the requested limits.

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

get.description: Find a set of recipes that adhere to the given nutritional limits. All the returned recipes will have macro nutrients within the calories, protein, fat, and carbohydrate limits.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The (natural language) recipe search query.

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more comma separated (will be iterpreted as 'OR'). See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: excludeCuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) the recipes must not match. One or more comma separated (will be iterpreted as 'AND'). See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. See a full list of supported diets.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found recipes must not have ingredients that could cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. See a full list of supported intolerances.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: The equipment required. Multiple values will be interpreted as 'or'. For example, value could be "blender, frying pan, bowl".

parameters.name: includeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that should/must be contained in the recipe.

parameters.name: excludeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients or ingredient types that must not be contained in the recipes.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the recipes. See a full list of supported meal types.

parameters.name: instructionsRequired
parameters.description: Whether the recipes must have instructions.

parameters.name: fillIngredients
parameters.description: Add information about the used and missing ingredients in each recipe.

parameters.name: addRecipeInformation
parameters.description: If set to true, you get more information about the recipes returned. This saves the calls to get recipe information.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The username of the recipe author.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: User defined tags that have to match.

parameters.name: titleMatch
parameters.description: A text that has to match in the title of the recipes.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The strategy to sort recipes by. See a full list of supported sorting options.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: The direction in which to sort. Must be either 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).

get.description: Search through hundreds of thousands of recipes using advanced filtering and ranking. NOTE: Since this method combines searching by query, by ingredients, and by nutrients in one endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the recipe.

parameters.name: includeNutrition
parameters.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information. Nutrition data is per serving. If you want the nutrition data for the entire recipe, just multiply by the number of servings.

get.description: Get information about a recipe.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of recipe ids.

parameters.name: includeNutrition
parameters.description: Include nutrition data to the recipe information. Nutrition data is per serving. If you want the nutrition data for the entire recipe, just multiply by the number of servings.

get.description: Get information about multiple recipes at once. That is equivalent of calling the Get Recipe Information endpoint multiple times but is faster.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the source recipe to which similar recipes should be found.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of random recipes to be returned (between 1 and 100).

get.description: Find recipes which are similar to the given one.

parameters.name: limitLicense
parameters.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows for displaying with proper attribution.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags (can be diets, meal types, cuisines, or intolerances) that the recipe must adhere to.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of random recipes to be returned (between 1 and 100).

get.description: Find random (popular) recipes.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to be autocompleted.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return (between 1 and 25).

get.description: Autocomplete a partial input to possible recipe names.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Get a recipe's equipment list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.summary: Get Recipe Price Breakdown by ID
get.description: Get a recipe's price breakdown data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Get a recipe's ingredient list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Get a recipe's nutrition widget data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

parameters.name: stepBreakdown
parameters.description: Whether to break down the recipe steps even more.

get.description: Get an analyzed breakdown of a recipe's instructions. Each step is enriched with the ingredients and the equipment that is used.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the recipe page.

parameters.name: forceExtraction
parameters.description: If true, the extraction will be triggered no matter whether we know the recipe already. Use that only if information is missing as this operation is slower.

get.description: Get an analyzed breakdown of a recipe's instructions. Each step is enriched with the ingredients and the equipment that is used.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Visualize a recipe's equipment list.

parameters.name: defaultCss

get.summary: Visualize Recipe Price Breakdown by ID
get.description: Visualize a recipe's price breakdown.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

showBacklink.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular. If set false, this call counts against your quota.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

mode.description: The mode in which the widget should be delivered. 1 = separate views (compact), 2 = all in one view (full).

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

showBacklink.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular. If set false, this call counts against your quota.

post.description: Visualize the price breakdown of a recipe.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

view.description: Either "grid" or "list" as visualization of the equipment.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

showBacklink.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular. If set false, this call counts against your quota.

post.description: Visualize the equipment used to make a recipe.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Summarize the recipe in a short text.

image.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

ingredients.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line (separate lines with \n).

instructions.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line (separate lines with \n).

readyInMinutes.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

servings.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

mask.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

backgroundColor.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

fontColor.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

instructions.example: Put the garlic in a pan and then add the onion.

post.description: Extract ingredients and equipment from the recipe instruction steps.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line (separate lines with \n).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The recipe search query.

schema.example: salmon with fusilli and no nuts

get.description: Parse a recipe search query to find out its intention.

parameters.name: ingredientName
parameters.description: The ingredient which you want to convert.

parameters.name: sourceAmount
parameters.description: The amount from which you want to convert, e.g. the 2.5 in "2.5 cups of flour to grams".

parameters.name: sourceUnit
parameters.description: The unit from which you want to convert, e.g. the grams in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "piece", e.g. "3.4 oz tomatoes to piece"

parameters.name: targetUnit
parameters.description: The unit to which you want to convert, e.g. the grams in "2.5 cups of flour to grams". You can also use "piece", e.g. "3.4 oz tomatoes to piece"

get.description: Convert amounts like "2 cups of flour to grams".

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

servings.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

includeNutrition.description: Whether nutrition data should be added to correctly parsed ingredients.

post.description: Extract an ingredient from plain text.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query - a partial or full ingredient name.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return (between 1 and 100).

parameters.name: metaInformation
parameters.description: Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All found ingredients must not cause problems for people with one of the given tolerances. See a full list of supported intolerances.

get.description: Autocomplete a search for an ingredient.

parameters.name: ingredientName
parameters.description: The name of the ingredient you want to replace.

get.description: Search for substitutes for a given ingredient.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the ingredient you want substitutes for.

get.description: Search for substitutes for a given ingredient.

ingredientList.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

view.description: Either "grid" or "list" as visualization of the equipment.

defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

showBacklink.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular. If set false, this call counts against your quota.

parameters.description: The id of the packaged food product.

get.summary: Visualize Menu Item Nutrition by ID
get.description: Visualize a menu items' nutrition data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The menu item id.

get.description: Get information about a certain menu item.

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: Either for one "day" or an entire "week".

parameters.name: targetCalories
parameters.description: What is the caloric target for one day? The meal plan generator will try to get as close as possible to that goal.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: Enter a diet that the meal plan has to adhere to. See a full list of supported diets.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of allergens or ingredients that must be excluded.

get.description: Generate a meal plan with three meals per day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner).

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine that should be paired, e.g. "merlot", "riesling", or "malbec".

get.description: Get a dish that goes well with a given wine.

parameters.name: food
parameters.description: The food to get a pairing for. This can be a dish ("steak"), an ingredient ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").

parameters.name: maxPrice
parameters.description: The maximum price for the specific wine recommendation in USD.

get.description: Find a wine that goes well with a food. Food can be a dish name ("steak"), an ingredient name ("salmon"), or a cuisine ("italian").

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine that should be paired, e.g. "merlot", "riesling", or "malbec".

get.description: Get the description of a certain wine, e.g. "malbec", "riesling", or "merlot".

parameters.name: wine
parameters.description: The name of the wine to get a specific product recommendation for.

parameters.name: maxPrice
parameters.description: The maximum price for the specific wine recommendation in USD.

parameters.name: minRating
parameters.description: The minimum rating of the recommended wine between 0 and 1. For example, 0.8 equals 4 out of 5 stars.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of wine recommendations expected (between 1 and 100).

get.description: Get a specific wine recommendation (concrete product) for a given wine, e.g. "merlot".

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The nutrition-related question.

schema.example: How much vitamin c is in 2 apples?

get.description: Answer a nutrition related natural language question.

text.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
text.example: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

post.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts. This task is also called Named Entity Recognition (NER). In our case the entities are foods. Either dishes, such as pizza and cheeseburger or ingredients, such as cucumber and almonds.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to search for. You can also use partial queries such as "spagh" to already find spaghetti recipes, articles, grocery products, and other content.

get.description: Search spoonacular's site content. You'll be able to find everything that you could also find using the search suggests on spoonacular.com. This is a suggest API so you can send partial strings as queries.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the recipes. See a full list of supported meal types.

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more comma separated. See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet to which the recipes must be compliant. See a full list of supported diets.

parameters.name: includeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that should/must be contained in the recipe.

parameters.name: excludeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients or ingredient types that must not be contained in the recipes.

parameters.name: minLength
parameters.description: Minimum video length in seconds.

parameters.name: maxLength
parameters.description: Maximum video length in seconds.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 900).

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return (between 1 and 100).

get.description: Find recipe and other food related videos.
Get a random joke that includes or is about food.
Returns random food trivia.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the food / ingredient.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of that food.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit for the given amount.

get.description: Get information about a certain food (ingredient).

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The request / question / answer from the user to the chat bot.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: An arbitrary globally unique id for your conversation. The conversation can contain states so you should pass your context id if you want the bot to be able to remember the conversation.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to have a conversation about food with the spoonacular chat bot. Use the "Get Conversation Suggests" endpoint to show your user what he or she can say.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A (partial) query from the user. The endpoint will return if it matches topics it can talk about.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of suggestions to return (between 1 and 25).

get.description: This endpoint returns suggestions for things the user can say or ask the chat bot.
